methods.depth:
The depth of the table is the maximum depth of its dependencies plus one. A table with no
 dependencies has a depth of zero.

:return: (int) the depth
methods.file:
Create a table via java deserialization.

 
 Note: stability of the format is not guaranteed.

:param path: (java.nio.file.Path) - the path to the file
:return: (io.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec) the table
methods.merge:
*Overload 1*  
  :param tables: io.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec...
  :return: io.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec
  
*Overload 2*  
  :param tables: java.util.Collection<? extendsio.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec>
  :return: io.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec
methods.walk:
Note: Java generics information - <V extends io.deephaven.qst.table.TableSpec.Visitor>

:param visitor: V
:return: V

text:
A table specification is a declarative description of a table query. Part of a "query syntax
 tree".

 
 A table specification may be built-up explicitly via the individual implementation class build
 patterns, or may be built-up in a fluent-manner via the TableOperations interface.

 
 A table specification can be "replayed" against the fluent interfaces, see
 TableCreator.create(TableCreator, TableToOperations, OperationsToTable, TableSpec).
